20101228130808.000|20101228130810.000|TR0|CHERNOFF:  The whole idea of the way the 
20101228130810.000|20101228130812.000|TR0|airlines deal with this storm is they get 
20101228130812.000|20101228130814.000|TR0|the planes out of the New York region, 
20101228130814.000|20101228130817.000|TR0|they also did that in Philly and Boston, 
20101228130817.000|20101228130819.000|TR0|et cetera, also Washington, D.C.  They 
20101228130819.000|20101228130821.000|TR0|want the planes away during the storm and 
20101228130821.000|20101228130823.000|TR0|then after the storm, they bring the 
20101228130823.000|20101228130825.000|TR0|planes back in.  They say that's the 
20101228130825.000|20101228130827.000|TR0|quickest way to minimize their losses and 
20101228130827.000|20101228130830.000|TR0|most importantly, to get the schedule back 
20101228130830.000|20101228130832.000|TR0|up to normal.
20101228130832.000|20101228130834.000|TR0|
20101228130834.000|20101228130836.000|TR0|Now, it's taken a little longer than the

20101228132851.000|20101228132853.000|TR0|annualcreditreport.com and get a free

20101228135745.000|20101228135747.000|TR0|accept it, that I will live.
